data.title: Great lunch
data.text: We had a pleasant lunch. The portion sizes were just right. The dessert trio was a great addition. We look forward to going back for live music during dinner.

data.title: A delightful surprise
data.text:
The service was so attentive!  We sat on the patio and watched the world go by, drank great mules, ($4 on Wednesdays ), listened to live music and had delicious food! 
 Viva La France!

data.title: wowed by their desserts!
data.text: We just dropped in for a mid day dessert and coffee--they were closing in  20 minutes but graciously seated us and and promptly delivered fresh coffee! We 3 ladies order one dessert--the three combo, which was perfect for us to share! It consisted of a.creme brulee, Apple tart, and cream puff. Presentation was lovely and all three, very good!! Excellent service!!

data.title: Sunday night special!!
data.text: The menu offers something for everyone: lots of small plates, salads, dinners and some French specialties. Service is spotty. On Sunday evenings they have a wonderful combo of 3 - 4 musicians. When you close your eyes, you're in New Orleans! The music is wonderful, they seem to be there to jam, and the fact that there is an audience is secondary! Sit outside on Canton Street (the chairs have cushions...) and you'll want to stay all night!

data.title: Smaller portions, but good flavor
data.text: Love the little area of Roswell where this restaurant is located. The atmosphere was nice as was the choice of decor. We had decent service when we were there. The bison spare rib was cooked perfectly and had lots of flavor. I wish they had given larger portions of the sides to go with the meat. Overall a decent experience and would definitely try it again.

data.title: Dinner with drinks
data.text: Here to visit my favorite bartender Abby. They have live music with outdoor seating.  The oysters are great.

data.title: Rehearsal dinner
data.text: we were there for a rehearsal dinner Service and food was fantastic.  Would defintely go back there and highly recommend it

data.title: Popular place with music most nights.
data.text: Met a friend there on. Thursday night. Extensive wine list, reasonably priced. Menu includes nice selection of small plates so you can eat Spanish a Tapas style. Quite good.....but bring a French style restaurant food was rich. Ended taking some home. Service staff very nice.

data.title: Great lunch choice
data.text: Pastis is a good choice to meet someone for lunch. Weather permitting, they have outdoor seating.  I had the Tuna Nicoise salad and the generous portion was delicious! My friend had the chicken salad and she enjoyed it. A good part of my salad was organic, which is important to me!

data.title: Fabulous dinner, will come back
data.text: We were very impressed with the food. We were there on a Monday night, where most restaurants are closed on the Square, they were open but honestly may need to close as there was no one else there. But the service, obviously, and the food were fabulous! We had a crab and shrimp with avocado, etc appetizer with filet mignon and steak as the main dishes.  Absolutely no complaints.  A favorite restaurant has now been added. And we are picky, it is unusual for both of us to have no complaint. I will say it was a bit pricey at $85.

data.title: Wonderful Anniversary Celebration!
data.text: We had a wonderful anniversary dinner. We walked out of a restaurant where we could not get any service( not even water) and on our way back to the car we decided to stop off at Pastise to get a drink and a snack. The service, thanks to Susan, was so fantastic that we ordered many appetizers and I drank some delicious cocktails while listening to nice acoustic music. We will return often

data.title: French food but not french quality standards
data.text: This nicely decorated restaurant in the heart of Roswell offers a selection of french specialities. Being in North America I selected the Bison ribs which turned out to need a lot of chewing energy. The Ratatouille is not what you get in France under the same name, the green beans were hard and hardly cooked. The sorbet was terribly sweet, I could not finish it.

data.title: Wedding party "get acquainted" dinner.
data.text: Located in the heart of Old Roswell, Pastis offers a warm and inviting atmosphere. Good menu selections, dishes were very attractively presented, don't miss the crab cake. A downside is the lack of available parking on a Friday night (other than valet parking which I really don't like).

data.title: Good lunch spot
data.text:
Four of us for a late Wednesday lunch.  Sat outside so we could watch the people and cars go by.  Friendly service, nice shaded table.  Wife had the streak and frites  I had a chicken club sandwich.  Her meal was HUGE, with fresh cut fries and a nicely done steak.  Our friends had a French dip and a tuna Nicoise salad.
A bit pricey but a good meal.

data.title: GREAT SUNDAY BRUNCH
data.text: They offer bottomless Mimosas along with a great menu. Went there this past Sunday, and the service was outstanding. Highly recommend for lunch. Haven't been there for dinner in quite a while as the menu was not varied and pricey.

data.title: Tuesday wine special
data.text: Love this place.  I usually opt for heavy appetizers but if I am really hungry their bison spare ribs are to die for.  Tuesday's my favorite day to come because they have $9 bottomless glasses of wine.  Always live entertainment,  so enjoy!!!

data.title: Great Sunday Brunch Experience
data.text: While visiting friends, we left on Sunday morning to enjoy brunch on our way home. We were not aware that service would not begin until 11:30 AM and we arrived at 11:10 AM. The staff was very accommodating and invited us to sit at the bar where they even brought us coffee while we waited for service to begin.  Both the Breakfast Skillet and the French Toast entrée were excellent.  The indoor/outdoor feel of the restaurant that is achieved by the opening of massive glass garage doors was especially pleasant on a beautiful Sunday spring morning.

data.title: Expected Better
data.text:
This was a first visit to Downtown Roswell and wanted a good Restaurant. We asked a local and they pointed in the direction of this French Restaurant. It was lunch and so we wanted something light.
Although the service was fair the time it took for food exceeded a normal wait time. The waitress did apologize several times! Wine and cocktail were good but the food lacked flare I believed. Having been to Italy/France on numerous occasions this just restaurant lacked that.
Location is great and sitting outside watching the world go bye was relaxing. I don't believe we will go here again. It try some of the other restaurants located just up the block.

data.title: Delicious bouillabaisse and nice wine for a bottomless
data.text: They really make a delicious bouillabaisse here. Seafood was plentiful and the base was quite nice. The bottomless wine glass on a Tuesday was well worth the price. Dave and had a guitarist on a Tuesday

data.title: Nice atmosphere, great food
data.text: We went to Pastis for dinner.  It was too cool to have the "garage door" open but I'm assuming they do when the weather is nicer.  That would make this great restaurant even more fun.  I had a steak that was perfectly cooked and my wife had the duck confit (she loved it, I thought it had too much of a strange spice).  The prices are in line with other historic Roswell restaurants.  We plan to go again.
